message.content:
Write an ESLint flat config (eslint.config.js) at /Users/imorgado/Documents/agent-girl/chat-236abf1c/splice-v3/eslint.config.js

Requirements:
- Use ESLint 9.x flat config format
- TypeScript support with @typescript-eslint
- Essential rules only (no-unused-vars, consistent-return, etc.)
- Ignore dist, node_modules, coverage
- Support for Lit decorators

Write a minimal, modern config. No explanations needed.

content.text: I'll read the project structure first to understand the setup, then write the ESLint flat config.

content.content: EISDIR: illegal operation on a directory, read

toolUseResult: Error: EISDIR: illegal operation on a directory, read

file.content:
{
  "name": "splice-v3",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "Adobe Premiere Pro UXP Plugin with selection tools and AI services integration",
  "main": "dist/index.js",
  "type": "module",
  "scripts": {
    "dev": "vite",
    "build": "tsc && vite build",
    "preview": "vite preview",
    "test": "vitest",
    "test:ui": "vitest --ui",
    "test:coverage": "vitest run --coverage",
    "test:e2e": "playwright test",
    "test:e2e:ui": "playwright test --ui",
    "test:all": "npm run test && npm run test:e2e",
    "lint": "eslint src --ext .ts,.tsx",
    "lint:fix": "eslint src --ext .ts,.tsx --fix",
    "format": "prettier --write \"src/**/*.{ts,tsx,css}\"",
    "typecheck": "tsc --noEmit",
    "uxp:watch": "uxp plugin watch dist",
    "uxp:load": "uxp plugin load dist/manifest.json",
    "uxp:reload": "uxp plugin reload",
    "uxp:debug": "uxp plugin debug",
    "uxp:package": "uxp plugin package",
    "prepare": "husky"
  },
  "keywords": [
    "adobe",
    "uxp",
    "premiere-pro",
    "plugin",
    "spectrum",
    "typescript"
  ],
  "author": "",
  "license": "UNLICENSED",
  "dependencies": {
    "@spectrum-web-components/theme": "^0.42.0",
    "@spectrum-web-components/button": "^0.42.0",
    "@spectrum-web-components/menu": "^0.42.0",
    "@spectrum-web-components/action-button": "^0.42.0",
    "@spectrum-web-components/icons-workflow": "^0.42.0",
    "@spectrum-web-components/picker": "^0.42.0",
    "@spectrum-web-components/textfield": "^0.42.0",
    "@spectrum-web-components/checkbox": "^0.42.0",
    "@spectrum-web-components/dialog": "^0.42.0",
    "@spectrum-web-components/toast": "^0.42.0",
    "@spectrum-web-components/progress-circle": "^0.42.0",
    "lit": "^3.2.1"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@adobe/cc-ext-uxp-types": "^1.0.1",
    "@playwright/test": "^1.49.1",
    "@types/node": "^22.10.2",
    "@typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin": "^8.18.0",
    "@typescript-eslint/parser": "^8.18.0",
    "@vitest/coverage-v8": "^2.1.8",
    "@vitest/ui": "^2.1.8",
    "eslint": "^9.17.0",
    "globals": "^15.14.0",
    "husky": "^9.1.7",
    "lint-staged": "^15.2.11",
    "prettier": "^3.4.2",
    "typescript": "^5.7.2",
    "vite": "^6.0.5",
    "vitest": "^2.1.8"
  },
  "lint-staged": {
    "*.{ts,tsx}": [
      "eslint --fix",
      "prettier --write"
    ],
    "*.{json,md,css}": [
      "prettier --write"
    ]
  },
  "engines": {
    "node": ">=20.0.0"
  }
}

content.text: Perfect. I have ESLint 9.17.0, @typescript-eslint packages at 8.18.0, and lit 3.2.1. Now I'll write the flat config:
Now verifying the config is syntactically correct:

content.content:
1→import globals from 'globals';
     2→import js from '@eslint/js';
     3→import ts from 'typescript-eslint';
     4→
     5→export default [
     6→  {
     7→    ignores: ['dist', 'node_modules', 'coverage', '**/*.d.ts'],
     8→  },
     9→  js.configs.recommended,
    10→  ...ts.configs.recommended,
    11→  {
    12→    files: ['src/**/*.{ts,tsx}'],
    13→    languageOptions: {
    14→      ecmaVersion: 2024,
    15→      sourceType: 'module',
    16→      globals: globals.browser,
    17→      parser: ts.parser,
    18→      parserOptions: {
    19→        project: './tsconfig.json',
    20→      },
    21→    },
    22→    plugins: {
    23→      '@typescript-eslint': ts.plugin,
    24→    },
    25→    rules: {
    26→      'no-unused-vars': 'off',
    27→      '@typescript-eslint/no-unused-vars': [
    28→        'error',
    29→        { argsIgnorePattern: '^_' },
    30→      ],
    31→      '@typescript-eslint/consistent-type-imports': [
    32→        'warn',
    33→        { prefer: 'type-imports' },
    34→      ],
    35→      '@typescript-eslint/no-explicit-any': 'warn',
    36→      'no-constant-condition': 'warn',
    37→      'consistent-return': 'error',
    38→      'no-implicit-coercion': 'error',
    39→      'eqeqeq': ['error', 'always'],
    40→    },
    41→  },
    42→  {
    43→    files: ['**/*.test.ts', '**/*.spec.ts'],
    44→    languageOptions: {
    45→      globals: globals.node,
    46→    },
    47→  },
    48→];
    49→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

content.text:
Done. ESLint flat config written to `/Users/imorgado/Documents/agent-girl/chat-236abf1c/splice-v3/eslint.config.js`

**Key features:**
- ESLint 9.x flat config format
- TypeScript support via @typescript-eslint 8.18.0
- Lit decorator support (via TypeScript parser)
- Essential rules: no-unused-vars (with underscore pattern), consistent-return, eqeqeq, type-imports
- Ignores: dist, node_modules, coverage, .d.ts files
- Separate configuration for test files with Node globals
- Browser globals for source files
